title: Satoshi Yamaguchi (footballer, born 1959)
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Yamaguchi was born in <a href="Oita%20Prefecture">Oita Prefecture</a> on August 1, 1959. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Mitsubishi Motors</a> in 1978. However he did not play in the game, as he was the team's reserve goalkeeper behind <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> player <a href="Mitsuhisa%20Taguchi">Mitsuhisa Taguchi</a>. He retired in 1984. Eventually he could not play in the game.
National team career.
In August 1979, Yamaguchi was selected <a href="Japan%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Japan U-20 national team</a> for <a href="1979%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">1979 World Youth Championship</a>. However, he did not compete, as he was the team's reserve goalkeeper behind <a href="Yasuhito%20Suzuki">Yasuhito Suzuki</a>. In February 1981, although he did not play at his club, he was selected <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> because Japan's manager <a href="Saburo%20Kawabuchi">Saburo Kawabuchi</a> actively appointed young players. On February 19, Yamaguchi debuted for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> against <a href="Singapore%20national%20football%20team">Singapore</a>.
